Series.Actors: |Anna Faris|Allison Janney|Sadie Calvano|Matt Jones|Jaime Pressly|Kevin Pollak|French Stewart|Blake Garrett Rosenthal|Spencer Daniels|Nate Corddry|Beth Hall|
Series.Overview: From hit-maker Chuck Lorre comes his next big comedy‐an irreverent and outrageous take on true family love‐and dysfunction. Newly sober single mom Christy struggles to raise two children in a world full of temptations and pitfalls. Testing her sobriety is her formerly estranged mother, now back in Christy's life and eager to share passive-aggressive insights into her daughter's many mistakes.

Episode.EpisodeName: Pilot Promotion
Episode.Overview: Get a sneak peek of the new comedy from Chuck Lorre, starring Anna Faris and Emmy® winner Allison

Episode.EpisodeName: On the Set
Episode.Overview: Go behind the scenes of the new comedy from Chuck Lorre starring Anna Faris and Emmy® winner Allison

Episode.EpisodeName: Gag Reel
Episode.Overview: Laugh along with the cast members' bloopers and funny moments

Episode.EpisodeName: Pilot
Episode.GuestStars: |Courtney Henggeler|David de Lautour|Robert Curtis Brown|Reggie De Leon|Duane Shepard Sr.|Chris Errie Maddox|Carol Herman|Rhona Gordon|Jim Marshall|Nick Bakay|Jon Cryer|
Episode.Overview: Christy is a mother struggling with raising her kids and staying sober at the same time. It doesn't help when her mother reappears in her life and she discovers a life changing fact about her teenage daughter.

Episode.EpisodeName: A Pee Stick and an Asian Raccoon
Episode.GuestStars: |Shane Blades|George Paez|Kristen O’Meara|Jill Lover|Kotaro Watanabe|Mark Berry|Lyn Alicia Henderson|
Episode.Overview: Christy and Bonnie set aside their differences to deal with a family crisis together.

Episode.EpisodeName: A Small Nervous Meltdown and a Misplaced Fork
Episode.Overview: Christy goes on her first date since she stopped drinking. Meanwhile, Bonnie teaches her grandson Roscoe to gamble.

Episode.EpisodeName: Loathing and Tube Socks
Episode.GuestStars: |Mimi Kennedy|Jim Holmes|Matt Cook|Christopher Darga|Reggie De Leon|Lyn Alicia Henderson|
Episode.Overview: Christy’s patience is tested by everyone she knows. Meanwhile, Bonnie runs into an old rival.

Episode.EpisodeName: Six Thousand Bootleg T-Shirts and a Prada Handbag
Episode.Overview: Christy makes a new friend who has big problems. Meanwhile, Bonnie attempts to put someone else's needs ahead of her own.

Episode.EpisodeName: Abstinence and Pudding
Episode.Overview: Christy is determined to take things slow in her relationship with Adam. Meanwhile, Bonnie and her rival from AA, Marjorie, disagree on what "taking it slow" means.

Episode.EpisodeName: Estrogen and a Hearty Breakfast
Episode.Overview: Christy squares off against Luke's conservative parents, who are upset about Violet's pregnancy. Meanwhile, Bonnie is determined not to let menopause get the best of her.

Episode.EpisodeName: Big Sur and Strawberry Lube
Episode.Overview: Christy is nervous about going on a romantic weekend getaway with Adam. Meanwhile, Gabriel's wife suspects he is cheating and seeks comfort from Christy.
Episode.Writer: |Chuck Lorre|Eddie Gorodetsky|Gemma Baker|Nick Bakay|Alissa Neubauer|Christine Zande|

Episode.EpisodeName: Zombies and Cobb Salad
Episode.Overview: When Bonnie loses her job and struggles to keep her life together, Christy tries to get her back on track.
Episode.Writer: |Chuck Lorre|Eddie Gorodetsky|Gemma Baker|Nick Bakay|Alissa Neubauer|Christine Zander|

Episode.EpisodeName: Belgian Waffles and Bathroom Privileges
Episode.Overview: Christy has trouble accepting how much easier life is with Bonnie in the house. Meanwhile, Baxter sets up camp in the driveway.
Episode.Writer: |Chuck Lorre|Eddie Gorodetsky|Gemma Baker|Nick Bakay|Alissa Neubauer|Christine Zander|

Episode.EpisodeName: Cotton Candy and Blended Fish
Episode.Overview: Christy and Bonnie go above and beyond to help a sick friend. Meanwhile, Violet is frustrated by the realities of pregnancy.

Episode.EpisodeName: Corned Beef and Handcuffs
Episode.Overview: Christy gets stuck in the middle when Bonnie and Chef Rudy start dating.
Episode.Writer: |Chuck Lorre|Eddie Gorodetsky|Gemma Baker|Nick Bakay|Alissa Neubauer|Christine Zander|

Episode.EpisodeName: Hot Soup and Shingles
Episode.Overview: When Christy gets injured, she refuses to admit she needs Bonnie's help. Meanwhile, Luke turns to Baxter for advice about being a father.

Episode.EpisodeName: Leather Cribs and Medieval Rack
Episode.Overview: Christy and Bonnie come clean about secrets they've been keeping from each other. Meanwhile, Violet and Luke discover they have different ideas about parenting.

Episode.EpisodeName: Fireballs and Bullet Holes
Episode.Overview: Christy tries to start a relationship with her father, Alvin, while Bonnie struggles to accept that Christy wants him in her life.

Episode.EpisodeName: Nietzsche and a Beer Run
Episode.GuestStars: |Nick Zano|Mary Pat Gleason|Jack Impellizzeri|Marcus Folmar|Ron Roggé|
Episode.Overview: Christy is tempted by her old vices when she dates an attractive, hard-partying man. Meanwhile, Bonnie decides her advice is worth money and becomes a life coach.

Episode.EpisodeName: Jail, Jail and Japanese Porn
Episode.GuestStars: |Octavia Spencer|Tiffany Dupont|Jim Jansen|Reggie De Leon|Bob Glouberman|
Episode.Overview: When Christy puts her new relationship ahead of friends and family, Bonnie has to pick up the slack.

Episode.EpisodeName: Sonograms and Tube Tops
Episode.GuestStars: |Brian Stepanek|Rizwan Manji|Reggie De Leon|Sloane Avery|Peter Banifaz|
Episode.Overview: Christy plans a baby shower for Violet, who is nervous about becoming a mom. Meanwhile, Bonnie scores a new life-coaching client.
Episode.Writer: |Nick Bakay|Sheldon Bull|Eddie Gorodetsky|Chuck Lorre|Marco Pennette|Gemma Baker|

Episode.EpisodeName: Toilet Wine and the Earl of Sandwich
Episode.Overview: Christy and Bonnie help Regina tie up loose ends on the way to drop her off at prison. Meanwhile, Alvin spends the day getting to know his grandkids.

Episode.EpisodeName: Clumsy Monkeys and a Tilted Uterus
Episode.GuestStars: |Don McManus|Ryan Cartwright|Melissa Tang|Lyn Alicia Henderson|Regi Davis|Molly Hawkey|
Episode.Overview: Christy and Bonnie try to make sure everything goes smoothly when Violet finds the perfect couple to adopt her baby.

Episode.EpisodeName: Broken Dreams and Blocked Arteries
Episode.GuestStars: |Kevin Pollak|Ryan Cartwright|Melissa Tang|Wayne Wilderson|Ericka Kreutz|Stacy Arnell|Rob Busch|
Episode.Overview: Christy is caught in the middle when tensions rise between Bonnie and Alvin. Meanwhile, a very pregnant Violet is apprehensive about going to her senior prom.

Episode.EpisodeName: Smokey Taylor and a Deathbed Confession
Episode.GuestStars: |Mimi Kennedy|Kevin Pollak|Ryan Cartwright|Melissa Tang|Rizwan Manji|Wayne Wilderson|Zylan Brooks|
Episode.Overview: Christy and Bonnie help Violet through labor. Meanwhile, Christy is convinced that Bonnie still has feelings for Alvin.

Episode.EpisodeName: Hepatitis and Lemon Zest
Episode.GuestStars: |Jaime Pressly|Jonny Coyne|James Earl|Reggie De Leon|Meredith Giangrande|Derek Thompson|Tim Trobec|David Ghilardi|Johnny Kostrey|
Episode.Overview: Bonnie is furious when Christy's poor financial decisions threaten the family's living situation. Meanwhile, Christy agrees to help out Jill, a woman who is newly sober.

Episode.EpisodeName: Figgy Pudding and the Rapture
Episode.GuestStars: |Kevin Pollak|Jonny Coyne|Jaime Pressly|Daniel Steven Gonzalez|Jim Hanna|Andrew T. Lee|
Episode.Overview: The family becomes essentially homeless, yet Christy convinces herself that everything is fine as Bonnie tries to get her to face reality. Jaime Pressly and Kevin Pollak guest star.

Episode.EpisodeName: Chicken Nuggets and a Triple Homicide
Episode.Overview: In order to get the family back together, Christy and Bonnie rent a house with a colorful past. Meanwhile, Bonnie tries to broker a peace between Christy and Alvin.

Episode.EpisodeName: Forged Resumes and the Recommended Dosage
Episode.GuestStars: |Steven Banks|Ryan Cartwright|Mary Pat Gleason|Beth Hall|Alison La Placa|Jim Piddock|Kevin Pollak|Melissa Tang|
Episode.Overview: Christy tries to determine the reason behind Violet's strange behavior; Bonnie goes on a search for a job.

Episode.EpisodeName: Kimchi and a Monkey Playing Harmonica
Episode.Overview: Christy is not sure how she feels about Candace and Baxter's relationship.

Episode.EpisodeName: Crazy Eyes and a Wet Brad Pitt
Episode.Overview: Christy and Bonnie are in the lap of luxury when Christy's wealthy sponsee, Jill, asks them to keep her company on her first night out of rehab.

Episode.EpisodeName: Soapy Eyes and a Clean Slate
Episode.Overview: Christy is on a journey to right the wrongs of her past, but she has a blind spot when it comes to Baxter. Following Christy's example, Bonnie decides to come clean with Alvin about the terrible things she did to him over the years.

Episode.EpisodeName: Free Therapy and a Dead Lady's Yard Sale
Episode.Overview: Family secrets come out when Christy and Bonnie are asked to join Violet's therapy session.

Episode.EpisodeName: Godzilla and a Sprig of Mint
Episode.Overview: Christy's evening alone takes an unexpected turn when she meets her attractive, single neighbor, Andy. Bonnie and Alvin's romantic plans are derailed by Alvin's ex-wife, Lorraine.

Episode.EpisodeName: Nudes and a Six-Day Cleanse
Episode.Overview: After realizing she's been a waitress longer than she planned, Christy takes steps towards a new career. Also, Bonnie and Alvin try to recapture their youth.

Episode.EpisodeName: Three Smiles and an Unpainted Ceiling
Episode.Overview: An unexpected death rocks the Plunkett household.

Episode.EpisodeName: Kitty Litter and a Class A Felony
Episode.Overview: Christy does damage control when Bonnie acts out after the death of a loved one.

Episode.EpisodeName: Cheeseburger Salad and Jazz
Episode.Overview: Christy is concerned with the way Bonnie is processing Alvin’s death and tries to get her professional help.

Episode.EpisodeName: Benito Poppins and a Warm Pumpkin
Episode.Overview: When Christy gets promoted to manager of the restaurant, she discovers that being the boss comes with its own set of problems. Also, Bonnie has a nemesis in the building who wants her fired.

Episode.EpisodeName: Turkey Meatballs and a Getaway Car
Episode.Overview: Christy discovers she enjoys sex most when there's a risk of getting caught. Meanwhile, Bonnie takes her new role as secretary of the women's meeting a little too seriously

Episode.EpisodeName: Dirty Money and a Woman Named Mike
Episode.Overview: Christy and Bonnie are shocked when they discover how prison has changed their friend Regina.

Episode.EpisodeName: A Commemorative Coin and a Misshapen Head
Episode.Overview: Christy and Bonnie worry when they find out that Violet's new boyfriend is old enough to be her father.

Episode.EpisodeName: Dropped Soap and a Big Guy on a Throne
Episode.Overview: Christy and Bonnie face temptation when Bonnie is prescribed pain medication for a back injury.

Episode.EpisodeName: Mashed Potatoes and a Little Nitrous
Episode.Overview: Bonnie goes to extremes to keep a major secret from Christy.

Episode.EpisodeName: Sick Popes and a Red Ferrari
Episode.Overview: After Bonnie’s relapse, the women from her meeting rally around to help her through withdrawal from painkillers, but Christy wants no part of it.

Episode.EpisodeName: Patient Zero and the Chocolate Fountain
Episode.Overview: Christy and Bonnie’s contentious relationship makes them unwelcome guests wherever they go

Episode.EpisodeName: Fun Girl Stuff and Eternal Salvation
Episode.Overview: Christy blames Bonnie when Roscoe announces he wants to go live with his father, on the second season finale.

Episode.EpisodeName: Terrorists and Gingerbread
Episode.Overview: Bonnie's mother, Shirley (Academy Award winner Ellen Burstyn) --- who abandoned Bonnie when she was young --- suddenly wants to be a part of Christy and Bonnie's lives!

Episode.EpisodeName: Thigh Gap and a Rack of Lamb
Episode.Overview: After Bonnie and Christy meet a teenage addict named Jodi at a meeting, they try to help her.

Episode.EpisodeName: Mozzarella Sticks and a Gay Piano Bar
Episode.Overview: After helping a recovering drug addict, Bonnie and Christy get addicted themselves to the rush of assisting others. As a result, they take on a new "project" named Michelle (Judy Greer).

Episode.EpisodeName: Sawdust and Brisket
Episode.Overview: Christy is overjoyed when Violet wants to improve their relationship and spend more time together; Bonnie tries to make amends with an enemy.

Episode.EpisodeName: A Pirate, Three Frogs and a Prince
Episode.Overview: Christy feels threatened by Baxter's girlfriend in the wake of Roscoe's parent-teacher conference. Bonnie flirts with an unlikely target.

Episode.EpisodeName: Horny-Goggles and a Catered Intervention
Episode.Overview: Regina doesn't think she's an alcoholic and Wendy encourages the ladies to attand a sober holiday dance.

Episode.EpisodeName: Kreplach and a Tiny Tush
Episode.Overview: Christy hosts a dinner attended by Violet's future mother-in-law, who is hard to please. Steve wants to take his relationship with Bonnie to the next level.

Episode.EpisodeName: Snickerdoodle and a Nip Slip
Episode.Overview: When Christy catches the eye of Candace's wealthy, charming father Fred, Candace and Baxter are outraged while Bonnie pushes Christy to give him a chance.

Episode.EpisodeName: My Little Pony and a Demerol Drip
Episode.Overview: Christy's burgeoning relationship with Fred gets more and more difficult for Candace to handle. However, Bonnie enjoys the perks of Chrsty dating a wealthy man.

Episode.EpisodeName: Quaaludes and Crackerjack
Episode.Overview: In order to avoid her ex-boyfriend, Bonnie drags Christy to a new AA meeting, only to run into her ex-girlfriend, Jeanine, from 30 years ago.

Episode.EpisodeName: Cinderella and a Drunk MacGyver
Episode.Overview: Christy tries to help Julian (Joe Manganiello), a handsome, newly sober AA member, but her attraction to him complicates things. Meanwhile, Bonnie jumps at the chance to attend a lavish charity gala with Jill.

Episode.EpisodeName: Diabetic Lesbians and a Blushing Bride
Episode.Overview: When Marjorie announces she getting married, Christy and Bonnie are determined to make it a perfect day.

Episode.EpisodeName: Sticky Hands and a Walk on the Wild Side
Episode.Overview: Christy, Jill and Wendy find themselves in a sticky situation when they agree to help Bonnie smuggle an illegal substance across the Canadian border.

Episode.EpisodeName: Death, Death, Death and a Bucket of Chicken
Episode.Overview: Christy tries to be supportive when a health scare throws Bonnie into a tailspin.

Episode.EpisodeName: Nazi Zombies and a Two-Hundred-Pound Baby
Episode.Overview: Bonnie tries to get Christy to admit she still has feelings for her ex-husband, Baxter.

Episode.EpisodeName: Cornflakes and the Hair of Three Men
Episode.Overview: When the restaurant closes for renovations, Christy takes a job as Jill's personal assistant. Also, Bonnie answers a wrong number and falls for the guy on the other end of the line, Adam.

Episode.EpisodeName: Caperberries and a Glass Eye
Episode.Overview: Christy encourages Bonnie to go out with a great new guy, Adam, only to find out he's not as great as she thought.

Episode.EpisodeName: Beast Mode and Old People Kissing
Episode.Overview: When Jodi's boyfriend, Travis (Jesse Luken), who was with her when she overdosed, shows up at an A.A. meeting, Christy struggles to show him the compassion he needs. Also, Bonnie's new boyfriend, Adam (William Fichtner), feels left out because she spends so much time at A.A.

Episode.EpisodeName: A Catheter and a Dipsy-Doodle
Episode.Overview: Despite being extremely ill, Christy insists on taking her final exams. Also, Bonnie is furious when she suspects her boyfriend, Adam, is cheating on her.

Episode.EpisodeName: Pure Evil and a Free Piece of Cheesecake
Episode.Overview: When Christy learns she made the Dean's List at school, she is disappointed by Bonnie's lackluster response.

Episode.EpisodeName: Mahjong Sally and the Ecstasy
Episode.Overview: Christy and Bonnie don’t know who to believe when they hear conflicting stories about Violet and Gregory’s break-up,

Episode.EpisodeName: Atticus Finch and the Downtrodden
Episode.Overview: Christy's dream of becoming a lawyer is in jeopardy when she is hit with the reality of how much her education will cost. Also, Bonnie becomes the disciplinarion with Violet back at home.
